description:
An overview of a wide variety of fascinating topics in mathematics, including complex numbers, the principle of inclusion-exclusion, power of a point, modular arithmetic, and more. Containing over 200 problems and filled with highly-motivated solutions and hints, this book is suitable for middle and high school students interested in developing a deeper conceptual understanding of math through learning by doing. 
 
 Raised funds for complimentary Featured by Minnesota State MATHCOUNTS.

We introduce Lie theory through the special case of matrix Lie groups. In doing so, we omit the topology that is essential to a more general study of Lie theory. In section 2, we introduce the notion of a matrix Lie group along with several basic definitions and properties of matrices. Section 3 defines and details matrix exponentiation; in section 4, we discuss tangent spaces and the Lie bracket, and in section 5 their connections to Lie algebras.

Rough notes: Proofs of strange 3-adic identities regarding [ SUM (2i choose i) for i=0 to n-1 ] using Hensel's Lemma and Multivariable Calculus, originally Proposed by Nicholas Strauss, Pontificia Universidade Catolica do Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and Jeffrey Shallit, Dartmouth College in the American Math Monthly, 6625 [1990, 252].
